subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Dany Heatley’s second goal of the game, with 46.8 seconds remaining, lifted Canada to a 5-4 victory over the United States at the world championships Tuesday in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Brent Burns, Jonathan Toews and Derek Roy also scored for the Canadians (3-0). Zach Parise, Patrick O’Sullivan, Dustin Brown and Jason Pominville scored for the Americans (2-1). Earlier in Quebec City, Alex Ovechkin and Sergei Fedorov each scored a goal as Russia beat Denmark, 4-1.
